Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I screwed up real bad. I really screwed up.

Speaker: emily

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You gotta help me Brendan I think tug- Oh!

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Hey Brendan. It's been awhile. Where you been eating?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Huh. Yeah, no one's seen you. What's it been, a couple months?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah, it's been awhile. You gave Emily my locker number?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: A few days ago. Was I wrong?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: It's been so long, I don't know you two's stats.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It has been awhile.   Who's she been eating with? THE BRAIN  I dunno. It's hard to keep track.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: She hasn't been doing too good.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah well. I'm not looking for a patch up. Em's life is her own. But she asked for my help.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't even care, it's not my business. I just want to know she's ok, so I've got to find her. That's all this is.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Well. I know she was poking in with the Ivy-bound cheerleading elite. Laura Dannon's crowd.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Laura Dannon there with the Rabbit?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Yeah. Brad Bramish with her. Cream on the upper crust.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: I won't argue then. Anyway Em tagged after them for a bit, but it didn't work. So she picked her way down the food chain. Last I seen she was with whasshername, that drama vamp. Small time dealer, augh, the evil one, the one you dated-

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Thanks Brain. Keep your specs on, find me if she shows.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Come to see the show? Kisses the freshman's forehead, purring.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm all friendly.  Watch your head, kid - that thing bites.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Still picking your teeth with freshmen?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Way once, sister. You and Em were tight for a bit. Who's she eating with now?

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Guess you're up from the underneath then. The whole Jerr thing blown over. Lucky strikes, you and your partner get bulled, you come up clean. But I guess you were always the brains of the outfit.1

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Sometimes I wonder why I dumped you.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: I don't know where she's at, Brendan.

Dialogue: I know you do, so why don't you want me to find her?

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Maybe I'm looking out for you.

Speaker: kara

Speaker: woman's voice

Dialogue: Well then I don't think you're invited to my party. It's a rather exclusive gathering. BRENDAN I can imagine.  You should really work on your invite management. A beat of silence.

Speaker: laura's voice
Dialogue: You think you're cute, whoever you are.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Wait'll you get a load of my felt fedora and spats.

Speaker: laura's voice
Dialogue: Who are you? Or I'll hang up.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You don't know me - I'll save you some time.

Speaker: laura's voice
Dialogue: I know everyone and I've got all the time in the world.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Folly of youth. Ask whose invitation I've got.

Speaker: laura's voice
Dialogue: 15 Bush street, up in Stockton Cove. Buzz 42 at the gate. Nine o'clock. But who-

Dialogue: If the coach wants to play me I'll play, but I can't put my best game in if I've got to worry about whether I'm going to be in there. Halftime last game, coach is pissed I ran it on a pass play, out on the field he says to me 'you gotta think about the team and you gotta' you know and 'if you run that ball again you're out', and I said to him you gotta let me play! I'm out there, let me play, and he's saying 'no you're out' and I kept saying 'Let me play! Let me play! Let me play!', just right in his face-

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Just 'Let me play! Let me play! Let me play!' 'No you gotta' 'No, let me play! Let me play! Let me play!'

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: He doesn't give me a play to make, what can I do, you know?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Uh huh. Unless your anecdote's got a 2nd act.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I like a man who knows what he's drinking.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's a pretty sick thing to be attracted to.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Brad's not a good guy to get on the wrong side of.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Fearless flyer. Quit your yappin and fix me one.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I'll never get through all this.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I knew your old partner Jerr since grade school. Tough break. How long were you two joined up before your operation got the sting?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: A few months. Could have helped himself out by turning me in, but he took the heat. He was a good guy. Solid.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Yeah I did. So why are you here tonight?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Well like you said, I've got to work on that. Em's been AWOL for a good month, nobody's seen her.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Nearly nobody's seen her. So what did she tell you?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Listen, you're scratching at the wrong door. I wasn't with Emily enough to know details of what she was in, I just got wind of the downfall, and I didn't get any details of that, except that it was bad. So now that we're showing some cards...

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: If you haven't got a finger in Em's troubles, why'd her name get me into your rather exclusive party?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Keep up with me now. I don't know, but it sounded like you did, and a body's got a right to be curious. Now I'm not so sure.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Well I'll put that body to bed. I don't know a damn thing about whatever troubles, and that works for me. I just want to find her.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: And you didn't hear it from me.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You'll stay right here and wait -- I'll be five minutes.

Dialogue: Hey Brendan. Maybe you shouldn't be here.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Kara told me you know where Em's at.

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: Uh huh.   And why are you looking for Em?

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: Uh huh. Listen man, I've got plenty on my plate without dealing with some jilted ex.

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: Whatever it's about, act smarter than you look and drop it.

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: She's with me, and right now that's the best place for her. Leave the low life to the low lifers and dangle.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You're on the bright side of dim, Dode, but if I thought you had this half- handled I'd be eating lunch. Where's she at?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Throw one at me if you want, hash head. I've got all five senses and I slept last night, that puts me six up on the lot of you.

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: She's with me. She was tight when she called you, man. Came to and freaked. She told me to shake you if you came by. Said you'd only make things worse.

Speaker: dode
Dialogue: Deal with whatever this ain't about and drop it.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tell Emily I want to see her. Tell her if she still wants my help or not that's her business, but I want to hear it straight from her.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Today. She knows where I eat lunch.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: I must have sounded pretty crazy on the phone. Yesterday.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Who fed you that line, Em?

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: And stop picking on Dode. He's a good guy.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: Yeah, what are you? Eating back here, not liking anybody, how are you judging anyone? I loved you alot but I couldn't stand it, I had to get with people. I couldn't heckle life with you, I had to see what was what.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You've got to come back to me, Em.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: No. No. Never. I'm sorry. Never. I can't love on your terms, Brendan. I can't do that, I'm not like you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You're in a spot, I can get you out of it. Come back to me, and whatever heat follows you I'll deal with.

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: No. You're not hearing me, no. I don't want to be put away and protected. No.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tell me about the trouble, the brick and the pin -

Speaker: emily
Dialogue: You gonna fix things like you did with Jerr? No. I came to say goodbye, for good. Whatever you have to do to let me go, do it. I'm gonna let you go, I've

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Hm. Do you know anything else about this?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Slim pickings. Why'd you let Dode fly when he came back to whose-her-name, at the theater?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Hm. Well, if this is what I think it is, it didn't come straight from Dode, less he's playing out of his league.  I can only give you my best guess.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: When the upper crust does shady deeds they do them in different spots around town. I know under the pier's one, down by the bike trails in the state park's another. There's alot of them. The pitch is they've got little symbols for each one, and that's how they tell each other the place, so word won't get around. So this might be that.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: This is upper crust. Dode's pie pan grease.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: How many places start with 'A'? Or if it's a shape, or just a random symbol. Anyway, even if you figured it out, what good could you do? She's smart, she knows the play, she's gunning to square things.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: You said her business was none of yours, so she's alright, forget it now. Go home, sleep.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah. What, are you here for zero?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Nah, I gotta take the early bus, cause the others don't run by my street.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Eh. Time to read's nice. So what's the word with Em?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Now. I don't know. I guess it's... I don't know.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: You think you can help her?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: You think you can get the straight, maybe break some deserving teeth?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Kara tried to rope me. She came right out and asked. She was scared. Tell me to walk from this, Brain. Tell me to drop it.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Walk from it. Drop it.  You're thick as what-all, Brendan. BRENDAN Yes I am.

Dialogue: No, bulls would gum it. They'd flash their dusty standards at the wide-eyes and probably find some yegg to pin, probably even the right one. But they'd trample the real tracks and scare the real players back into their holes, and if we're doing this I want the whole story. No cops, not for a bit.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I don't know. Your mom still have the cell?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Borrow it for a few days, get me the number.  Wait for my word, and cover for me first period. I'm going to be a little late.

Dialogue: You can't keep me safe, Brendan. I'm in a bigger world now, and you can't hide me from it, and you can't beat it. Not if I don't want you to.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Better stop meeting me in the open too. I'm going to start getting visible, and I need you on the underneath. I'll call.

Dialogue: Trueman asked for you. Wants words in his office.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I bet. Keep him off me - stonewall him, he won't bite, just keep him away from me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Make Em's troubles mine. I'm going to throw a few words at you, tell me if they catch. Brick.

Dialogue: Tug... that might be a drink.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Vodka and milk or something, or maybe not.

Dialogue: Frisco. Frisco Farr1 was a sophomore last year, I think. Real trash, maybe hit a class a week. Didn't know him then, and haven't seen him around.

Dialogue: The Pin's kind of a local spook story. You know the Kingpin? BRENDAN I've heard it.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Same thing. Supposed to be old, like 26, lives in town.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Big time... maybe. Ask any dope rat where their junk sprang they'll say they scraped it from that who scored it from this who bought it off so, and after four or five connections the list'll always end with the Pin. But I'll becha you got every rat in town together and said 'show your hands' if any of them've actually seen the Pin, you'd get a crowd of full pockets.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You think the Pin's just a tale to take whatever heat?

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Hey Brendan. Here for the show?

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Would you go then, honey, cause I've got this headache.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Try smoking like a chimney, I've heard that helps.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I don't want to play games if you've got a headache. Get me if you want to spill it, but I can't guarantee safe passage after tonight.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: I don't know what- At the stage door, not slowing.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tell the Pin that Brad was my calling card, and I need words.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Brad Bramish? Through the door and into the theater.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Tail Kara through lunch. She's got rehearsal but she'll blow early. She goes home, drop her, else wait for my call.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: That's all I'm saying, is put me in the game and I'll do what needs to be done, but they don't put me in, what needs doing don't get done and don't come crying to me, man. Get off my grill man, you didn't put me in, don't come to me if you didn't let me play.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: Hey! What are you doing here?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Alright, you got me. I'm a scout for the Gophers.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Of all things, yeah. Been watching your game for a month, but that story just now clenched it. You've got heart, kid. How soon can you move to Minneapolis?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Cold winters, but they've got a great public transit system.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: There's a thesaurus in the library. 'Yeah's under 'Y'. Go ahead, I'll wait.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: To the parking lot? Well gee I kind of invited myself.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: I think you'd better leave then.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: No, I'm having too good a time.

Speaker: brad
Dialogue: You know what's good for you you'll just beat it. Beating a small frye won't win me anything and it's not going to do you any good-

Dialogue: You're quite a pill. BRENDAN Uh huh.

Dialogue: Why did you take a powder the other night?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Same reason I'm taking one now.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Hold it.  I don't get you. That's a chilly heel to be giving a girl who's where you want to know about.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'll get where I'm going just fine.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I wouldn't have to lead you in by the hand-

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I can't trust you. Brad was a sap, you weren't, you were with him and so you were playing him, so you're a player. With you behind me I'd have to tie one eye up watching both your hands, and I can't spare it.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Sorry. Kara went home though, didn't she? THE BRAIN Yeah, but she stopped at a payphone and made two calls that she didn't want on her phone bill.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: S'alright. Are me and Brad front page news?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: All the buzz. You really do that?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Brad's a sap. I downed him on his field and his crew didn't bite. So now I know he's a sap and anyone who acts like he isn't is profiting by it. That's not why I roughed him, though.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Economics. Brad's the school's biggest jake buyer, so if this Pin is behind all the selling, I just got his attention. Anyway, now's just shaking things out. Look, you know a kid around the burgh, lanky, short, shaved head, turns a black tang?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: I told you before I don't know the car. Those types are a nickel a pound, but nobody I know that you don't. And Trueman again-

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Keep him off. And keep your specs on - I need to find that kid.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Like I said, he asked for my lunch money first. Good thing I brown bagged it.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: Alright Brendan. I've been looking to talk to you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: No. I gave you Jerr to see him eaten, not to see you fed.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: Mm. Anyway then, we know you're clean, and you've, despite your motives, you've been an asset to us. I think you're a good kid. BRENDAN Uh huh.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: I want to run a couple names by you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I was done here three months ago. I told you then I'd give you Jerr and that was that, I'm not your inside line and I'm not your boy.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You know what I'm in if the wrong yeg saw me pulled in here?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: No. And no more of these informal chats - if you've got a discipline issue with me write me up or suspend me and I'll see you at the parent conference.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: Hold it, I could - hold it - could write you up for talking back to a VP. For looking at me in a threatening way. I'd exercise a little more tact, Mr. Frye. You can't pull a play like that unless I need you for something. So do I?

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: So maybe you're gonna need me too.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Maybe. Alright, I need you off my back completely for a few weeks. There might be some heat soon.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: If it's something I can't cover, I won't go to bat for you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: If I get caught like that it's curtains anyway - I couldn't have brass cutting me favors in public. I'm just saying now so you don't come kicking in my homeroom door once trouble starts.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: Okay, here's what I can do. I won't pin you for anything you aren't caught at. I'll ride it a little while, as long as it doesn't get too rough. But if anything comes up with your fingerprints on it, I can't help you. Also, if I get to the end of whatever this is and it gets hot and you don't deliver, The Veep will need someone to hand over, police- wise. And I'll have you. There better be some meat at the end of this like you say, or at least a fall guy, or you're it.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Sure I am. Got one more favor to ask.

Speaker: trueman
Dialogue: Get the hell off my campus, punk! Brendan glances around, and limps off.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'm 9 of 10 that Kara's got him, but who knows where. I shook but she's not spilling.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: No more job offers? So she's got a play.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: And I know enough about Kara to let that worry me. Alright, keep your specs on for him. Any other news?

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Some. Laura Dannon came to me looking for you.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Fourth period, nearly shook me upside down. Can't say I didn't enjoy it, but why'd she come to me?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: She's tapping Kara, and Kara knows you know me.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Yeah, well. She's some piece of work. If I had known where you were I might have told her.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: That's the spirit. Ask around for Dode, tail Kara again at lunch. I got knives in my eyes, I'm going home sick. I'll call you tonight.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I want to see the Pin.

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Yeah.  So now I'm very very curious what you're going to say next.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Maybe I'll just sit and bleed at you.

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Helled if you're gonna go breaking my best clients' noses and expect me to play sandbag. Anyway you've been sniffing me out before then, sniffing for me like a vampire bat for a horse

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Call Ms. Dannon in from the hall first; she oughta hear this.

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: No dice, soldier. Would have been a neat trick, though.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I was going to make up some bit of information or set up some phony deal, anything so you'd let me walk. Then I was going to go to the vice principal and spill him the street address of the biggest dope port in the burgh.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: 1250 Vista Blanca, the ink blotter at the desk in the den in the basement of the house with the tacky mailbox.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Where are my glasses?  Hell with ya then. Which wall's the door in?

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Sorry about this kid, but what the hell with what you said before.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I thought we had orange juice, Brendan, I'm sorry. How about Tang, or that's more like soda isn't it, or not soda but it hasn't got any juice in it, it can't be very fortifying.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Now just a moment, we have apple juice here, if you'd like that, or milk, though you've got that in your cornflakes, I don't know if drinking it as well might be too much.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I'll even give it to you in a country glass, how'd that be? Boys?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Okay, well I'm going to go, um, do something in the other room now...

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: So hows bout we take another snap at hearing your tale?

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I don't know. It starts out same as before, and this floor ain't carpeted.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah well, your muscle seemed plenty cool putting his fist in my head. I want him out.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: The ape blows or I clam.

Speaker: tugger
Dialogue: So clam! What've you got I can't beat out of you back in the basement?

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Give us a few minutes, Tug.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: About a year ago I had a small time dealing partnership with Jerr Madison. Know him?

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Till he took the fall for you.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Yeah well. I didn't ask him to, but he was a straight player. I got out clean - almost. Nothing on my official record, but the VPs play it like I owe them one. When I made it clear I wasn't playing their hound dog, well they didn't like it. They keep calling me in, badgering me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I don't like being told whose side I'm on. So now they think I'm on your trail, I'm in a nice spot to know their movements and feed them yours.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Considering the benefits my services could yield, I don't think that's unreasonable.

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: And what are your services exactly, just so I can be specific on the invoice?

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: Fair enough. I'll have my boys check your tale, and seeing how it stretches we'll either rub or hire you. You'll know which by end of the day tomorrow.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I'll drive you back. INT. LAURA'S CONVERTIBLE MOVING - SUNSET

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Just drop me at school.  How long was I out?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Half an hour. It took all of it for me to cool the Pin down.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Less than when I didn't trust you before. If you can tell me your angle in this, maybe I can.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: A few months go by, and the next I hear the Pin's raging over a situation with some certain junk Em was partial to, and the downfall's coming on Em's head.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: You think Em scraped the junk off the Pin?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I don't know, but whether she scraped or copped or just ran her tab around the world and into her own back, it must have been grand. I've never seen the Pin so hot.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: This all helps but it's not what I asked. What's your angle in all this?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I don't know. I'm usually pretty sharp, but... maybe I see what you're doing for Emily, trying to help her. And I don't know anyone who would do that for me.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Where's Dode flopped?  I know you two are cozed up, so you'll tell me or you won't.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: Oooh, getting feisty.  Last time we talked you were giving ultimate-tims.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: It worked. You went to Laura, didn't you? Told her my tale.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: I feel so cheap and used.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Gol, I must seem a real cad. Sometimes I just hate myself.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: We were a pair and a half for a few months, weren't we? Sometimes I miss having someone I can talk to. You ever miss having someone? I guess you must.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I need to hear Dode's tale about Emily. It's important.

Speaker: kara
Dialogue: You better be sure you wanna know whatcha wanna know.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Uh huh. Laura's working with me now, and I'll have the Pin and Tug in my corner soon. The sooner I get the truth from Dode or the truth about Dode from you, the safer you'll both be. No? Pass it on to Dode anyway. Maybe he'll have the

Dialogue: Now we wait for the Pin's answer. Unless his crew spotted VP Truman's social call this morning, it'll be yes. I'd give us 70/30. If we're in I get under his skin and see what's what. You stick to Kara, keep your specs peeled for Dode and stay away from Laura.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: I think she's with us, Brendan.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: I'll let you know when she is.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Chuck Burns, big lug with hair like a sheepdog.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: Yeah I know him, I just can't pin him to any crowd. He's definitely not muscle for anyone. He taps the Carrows crowd but doesn't hang with them. If you've got a guess I could check it out-

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: The Pin. If he's with the Pin everything's kablooie and I gotta blow the burgh.

Speaker: the brain
Dialogue: I'll check it. I'm in third now- Brendan spots the Pin's Cady pulling into the parking lot.

Speaker: brendan
Dialogue: Never mind. If I don't call by three call in the bulls.

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: We're doing a thing down at the Hole tonight. Know it?

Speaker: pin
Dialogue: It's sort of a welcome you in thing. Eight o'clock.
